metadata.name: Grassroots Economics: Commitment Pooling in Kilifi, Kenya
Grassroots Economics: Commitment Pooling
metadata.description: Grassroots Economics is a movement and methodology for community-led resource coordination rooted in ancestral wisdom and living ecosystems. At its heart is the understanding that economies are not just about money they are about relationships, commitments, and shared well-being. We support communities to rediscover and activate commitment pooling a protocol based on collective promises to contribute and care. Just as trees and fungi exchange nutrients in underground networks, communities can pool labor, goods, services, and trust to meet shared needs without relying on centralized systems or external funding. Drawing from traditions like Mweria in Kenya and other rotating labor associations (ROLAs) worldwide, we help revive and adapt these systems using modern tools like mobile technology and blockchain. Our work supports villages, urban neighborhoods, cooperatives, and digital communities to create commons based on four key functions: Curation (what matters), Valuation (how it’s recognized), Limitation (fair access), and Exchange (how commitments are fulfilled). Grassroots Economics is about regenerating ecosystems social, ecological, and economic through reciprocity, resilience, and radical interdependence. It’s a return to the logic of living systems, where abundance flows through trust, not transactions. Whether in a forest, a village, or a digital network, we believe every community holds the capacity to thrive when rooted in care and connected through shared commitments.

data.title: Farm Making
data.description: 11 members for Mnyumbuni neighbors group came together and help mama Kadzo karisa to clear a bush and also help her in digging to prepare her small farm next to her house

data.title: Planting and Making Syntropic Beds
data.description: Members for kiriba mweria cycle group today came together and help mama Lydia Sidi plant cassava and also they helped her make 2 syntropic beds for planting vegetables,it took us one and a half hour to do all activities.

data.title: Pruning and Reinforcing Check Dams
data.description: 13 members for kiriba mweria cycle group today came together and help mama nyevu kahindi to do pruning and reinforcing her check dam through weaving with green stuffs

data.title: Planting Maize
data.description: Seven members for Mnyumbuni neighbors group came together this morning e help mama Joyce kalume plant maize,it took us one hour and a half  to plant the whole shamba.

data.title: Planting Maize
data.description: Members for Upendo came together this morning to help Joyce Jumwa plant maize,we managed to plant about half acre this morning in one and a half hour.

data.title: Making Syntropic Beds
data.description: Members from mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help Joyce kalume make syntropic beds.

data.title: Making Syntropic Beds
data.description: Members from mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help Joyce kalume make syntropic beds.

data.title: Digging soil for building mud house walls
data.description: 8 members for mnyumbuni neighbors came together this morning to help salama mbeyu dig soil for building her mud house walls.

data.title: Making Syntropic Beds
data.description: Members from mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help Joyce kalume make syntropic beds.

data.title: Collecting Manure
data.description: As a way for preparing for cultivation, upendo vikolani members are collecting cow dung manure inorder to scatter it on the uncultivated shamba.This helps to improve the fertility of the soil hence increasing the productivity of the crops.

data.title: Cultivation and Farm Preparation
data.description: Eleven members for mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help mama kadzo karisa caltivat her small farm nxt to her house, and in two hours we managed to do three quarters of her land that she set aside for farming.

data.title: Cultivation and Farm Preparation
data.description: Eleven members for mnyumbuni neighbors group today came together and help mama kadzo karisa caltivat her small farm nxt to her house, and in two hours we managed to do three quarters of her land that she set aside for farming.

data.title: Making makuti
data.description: 14 members for kiriba mweria cycle today came together and help kalama kea make makuti,we managed to make 30 pieces in one and a half hour.

data.title: Road repair and tree planting strategies
data.description: we have been reinforcing the base of the gabions to help make the water spread, sink and slow. preparing tree holes on the highest part of the gabions, surrounded by interconnected half moon shapes to help collect water

data.title: Digging septic tank
data.description: 9 members for mnyumbuni neighbors came together this morning to help mama rehema garama dig a septic tank ,we managed to dig about 3 feets deep since the area is so compacted.

data.title: Soap Making
data.description: Five members for mnyumbuni neighbors today came together and help mama salama mbeyu make soap for their home  use

data.title: Collecting building soil
data.description: 13 people for mnyumbuni neighbors group came together to help Agnes karisa collect building soil,every member came with a backet, some came with jembes,after digging we designed the place to look like a pond where Agnes karisa could even use to collect rainwater

data.title: Terracing and biomass management
data.description: We used logs, stones and branches to mark the edges, which also creates a microhabitat for small animals as well as water accumulation in the soil. We refilled with some earth that was accumulated in another part of the land in order to build more soil, like raised beds techniques.

data.title: Soil building and vetiver grass
data.description: W have been planting Vetiver to mark several areas of Mnyumbuni compound as well as planting around retention beds in a fence area of the garden. We also used the vetiver to plant around young trees to create a protection, shade and microclimate around it.

data.title: Local food production and syntropic agroforestry
data.description: Another beautiful day focusing on what nourishes us, taking care of the place we live in, singing traditional songs for nature and people care and we finished with a good meal. Thanks to the cook that are also part of the cycle of our farm to table project

data.title: Water retention landcape and erosion control
data.description:
we implemented check dams in the valley to tackle erosion control and water infiltration in the soil
Water retention landscaping

data.title: Soil regeneration and nursery development
data.description: Working at Mnyumbuni demo farm in Kiriba Village : improving soil quality, biomass accumulation and erosion control as well as developping the trees and vegetable nurseries

data.title: Cleaning and mulching
data.description: 18 members came to help Anthony kalume clean around posho mill ,we also use the grass on mulching around big trees

data.title: Cleaning and mulching
data.description: 18 members came to help Anthony kalume clean around posho mill ,we also use the grass on mulching around big trees

data.title: Soil building
data.description:
We started new compost piles
We prepared seaweed extract for the plants
We made soil tests in different parts of the shamba to get to know more our soil profile

data.title: Food diversity
data.description:
We selected a number of fruit trees and some vegetable seeds to start producing more food and diversifying crops
We are connecting this activity to soil certificates as well as nurseries and seedlings require good soil. We integrated vermicompost and biopreparation for plant growth

data.title: trees identification and seed collection
data.description:
We are collecting a participatory local plant database , gathering the traditional knowledge with the local communities
We are building guilds of plants for food, medicine, firewood, hardwood and handcrafts and also planning with drought resistant species

data.title: checkdams construction
data.description:
Mnyumbuni demo farm in Kiriba Village protects a valley of indigenous trees.
The valley is suffering erosion and the forest around is still young
We implemented 15 checkdams along the gullies formed by the rains
